column4: ip before = 10.10.10.10,  after = "nothing"  (becuase the DHCP server does NOT give it an address)
have you disabled the dhcp server on your router?
no DHCP anywhere other than the one on my server
linksys router? just login to the default page 192.168.1.1 no user, admin password
no DHCP servers other than the ubuntu based one I'm running on another box
ok so one iface gets dhcp address...the other is static?
y, that's how it's configured on the client side.
well if the iface is configured to use a static ip...then the dhcp server wont touch it since it wont know to
k, so that's the problem.  The client is configured to do static on eth1.  It DOES do static on eth1, then 5 minutes later it does DHCP on eth1
the question is,  WHY does it do DHCP on eth1, it's not configured to and shouldn't be
there is no  /etc/conf.d on this system, DISTRIB_RELEASE=9.04
there must be a simliar file though
n8tuser: looks like it's a weird artifact of the DCHP client daemon.  I haven't touchd a think on the config, simply restarted NetworkManger which restarted DCHP client on eth0
n8tuser: it seems stable now, i.e. eth1 is static and hasn't been messed with for several minutes
